docs.snippet: The Nationals have seen enough, in 83 major league starts, from Stephen Strasburg to understand how few peers can match his mastery of three exceptional pitches....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Nationals have seen enough, in 83 major league starts, from Stephen Strasburg to understand how few peers can match his mastery of three exceptional pitches.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column asserts that the Washington Nationals have seen enough, in 83 major league starts, from pitcher Stephen Strasburg to understand how few of his peers can match his mastery of three exceptional pitches; notes that Strasburg has a tendency to struggle in the first inning, but usually recovers in later innings.

headline.main: Nationals Put Trust in Strasburg, Even When He Falters
headline.print_headline: Trusting in an Ace, Even When He Falters

docs.snippet: Brian Roberts, who replaced the star second baseman Robinson Cano during the off-season, hit a game-winning homer Tuesday night and said he felt more relaxed with his new team....
docs.lead_paragraph: Brian Roberts, who replaced the star second baseman Robinson Cano during the off-season, hit a game-winning homer Tuesday night and said he felt more relaxed with his new team.
docs.abstract: New York Yankees second baseman Brian Roberts, who replaced Robinson Cano during the off-season, is beginning to feel more relaxed with his new team; his ninth-inning home run propelled the team to a 4-3 victory over the Los Angeles Angels.

headline.main: Yankees’ Roberts Stops Trying to Hit Like Cano and Starts to Thrive
headline.print_headline: Roberts Stops Trying to Hit Like Cano and Starts to Thrive

docs.snippet: Trailing 17-1 after five innings, the Clinton LumberKings were down — in their moods as well as on the scoreboard. Then the players, all prospects hoping to one day make the major leagues, started thinking back to last weekend, when they ove...
docs.lead_paragraph: Trailing 17-1 after five innings, the Clinton LumberKings were down — in their moods as well as on the scoreboard. Then the players, all prospects hoping to one day make the major leagues, started thinking back to last weekend, when they overcame an eight-run deficit.

docs.snippet: Homicide detectives searching for a California fire chief suspected of fatally stabbing his girlfriend turned their attention to the state's massive mountain ranges on Thursday, saying he may be hiding out along trails and backroads....
